Description: Fragment of base of Attic black-figured pottery dinos stand; interior and underside reserved; exterior: torus mouldings at top and bottom glazed black with incised blob rosettes between; slight remains of object (?foot) in field at base of stem above.
Producer name: Attributed to the Circle of: Sophilos
Curator's comments: The sherd belongs to the same vase as British Museum 1888,0601.570.a, 1888,0601.570.b, 1888,0601.570.c, 1888,0601.570.d and 1965, 0930.759. Clay analysed by M. Hughes and found to be Attic: G. Harbottle, M.J. Hughes and S. Seleem, 'The origin of black-figure Greek ceramics found in Naucratis (Nile Delta)', Archaeometry 47 (2005), 511-518; p. 513, table 1, no.20
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 480-1, no. B838)
Williams 1983 / Sophilos in the British Museum (p. 13, no. 15)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 225, no. 7a)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0277) (Phase 1)
